result.execSummary:
All charges against Mario Perez-Gomez in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mario Perez-Gomez is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Perez-Gomez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mario Perez-Gomez in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Mario Perez-Gomez.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. This matter was dismissed and read-in to defendant's lower pending matter regarding case 22JV449. Upon motion of State, Court ordered case DISMISSED with prejudice.

Defendant Mario Perez-Gomez in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for Patrick Anderson for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mario Perez-Gomez in court by video with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont who appears in person.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Mario Perez-Gomez in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Mario Perez-Gomez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mario Perez-Gomez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
